page.title: 04GENTRIFICATION
page.content: Many of the streets and squares of Hackney and Islington were laid out in the early 1900's for the rich,who,how- ever soon moved further out.The houses were taken by poorer people and,without the resources to maintain them many homes were threatened by the bulldozer. Then in the 1960's individuals and property companies began to invest in some areas.Gentrification is a process by which middle and upper classes enter a working class area.The size of the houses and nearness to central London were important factors.Good points are the improvement of the housing stock and better shopping facilities.Bad aspects are poorer groups being pushed out and so the housing problem is worsened,very high profits are made by speculators,and more up-market shops lead to general higher prices.
